nodes.value: a sandy or pebbly shore by ocean
Children love building sandcastles on the beach.
Un tiempo encantador, un buen rato
a very enjoyable experience or period
We had a lovely time at the picnic yesterday.
to go to see a person or place
I plan to visit my cousins next summer.
My grandmother bakes the best cookies.
to take someone out to lunch
to invite and pay for someone's lunch
He decided to take his colleague out to lunch to celebrate.
Ver a amigos, reunirse con amigos
I'm going to see some old school friends this weekend.
Durante mucho tiempo, por mucho tiempo
They haven't traveled abroad for a long time.
She is very excited about her new job opportunity.
to take delight or pleasure in
I really enjoy listening to music while I work.
a man serving food in a restaurant
The waiter was very attentive and polite.
statement of money owed for food
Could we have the bill, please?
pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically
The view from the top of the mountain was beautiful.
to remain in the same place
We decided to stay an extra day at the resort.
They promised to be best friends forever.
The children were excited about opening their presents.
Dar/organizar una fiesta, tener una fiesta
to organize or host a social gathering
We're planning to have a party for New Year's Eve.
unable to think clearly or understand
The complex instructions left him feeling very confused.
detailed information on how to do something
Please read the instructions carefully before use.
This chair is quite uncomfortable to sit on for long.
The market was very crowded on Saturday morning.
to support and move something from one place
Could you help me carry these heavy groceries?
He struggled to lift the heavy bags into the car.
It's too hot to go for a run right now.
She always feels nervous before an important exam.
to deliver a speech or presentation
The professor will give a talk on modern art.
sad from being without friends or company
He felt lonely when he first moved to the big city.
to pass time in a particular way
How do you like to spend your holidays?
a different nation from one's own
She dreams of traveling to another country each year.
Joining clubs is a good way to meet friends.
feeling anxious or troubled about problems
She was worried that she might be late.
If you have a bad cough, you should see a doctor.
I was amazed by the incredible skill of the performers.
a place where aircraft regularly take off and land
We arrived at the airport three hours before our flight.
He quickly got bored with the repetitive task.
late; not happening at the scheduled time
Our train was delayed by an hour due to track work.
to begin to feel bored or uninterested
Children often get bored on long journeys if not entertained.
to like one thing better than another
I prefer coffee in the morning.
having a great deal to do
He is always busy with his projects.
to be inactive or idle; relax
Sometimes it's nice to just sit and do nothing.
engaging in physical or mental activity
Leading an active lifestyle is good for health.
person one is in a relationship with
She lives with her partner in the city.
My colleague has to go away for work next week.
He enjoys spending weekends on his own.
no longer; not now as formerly
to become unable to think clearly
It's easy to get confused with so many options.
He is excellent at working with numbers.
It's wise to check bills before paying them.
Changes in bank rates can affect loans.
Cosas así, cosas por el estilo
I enjoy reading, writing, and things like that.
Many people hate going to the dentist.
to perceive something as difficult to understand
She finds the new software interface confusing.
to be greatly surprised or impressed by
You will be amazed by the stunning scenery.
the physical world and everything in it
Spending time in nature is good for the soul.
The magician performed some amazing tricks.
to begin to feel anxious or apprehensive
Many people get nervous before public speaking.
to arrange or plan an event or activity
They need to organise a meeting soon.
The wedding was a large social event.
invited to one's home for dinner
We're having some friends round to dinner tonight.
to feel anxious or troubled about
Try not to worry about things you cannot change.
a wide variety of items or matters
The museum displays all kinds of things from history.
We often go for a walk after dinner.
I usually catch up on the news in the evening.
matters regarded as unwelcome or harmful
Every situation can have its own set of problems.
There are so many stars visible tonight.
La mayor parte del tiempo, muchas veces
A lot of the time, I prefer to stay home.
to make an effort to avoid doing
I try not to be late for appointments.
to consider or reflect on something
She needs some time to think about the offer.
Suddenly, the power went out in the entire building.
to begin feeling anxious or concerned
People often start to worry when they hear uncertain news.
We had a lovely time there.
I took her out to lunch.
Voy a ver a unos amigos.
No los he visto desde hace mucho tiempo.
I haven't seen them for a long time.
Él acaba de empezar un nuevo trabajo.
He's just started a new job.
El camarero nos sonrió a Mark y a mí.
The waiter smiled at Mark and me.
Then he gave us the bill.
Me gustaría quedarme aquí para siempre.
I'd like to stay here forever.
emocionado/a: Es tu cumpleaños y vas a dar una fiesta.
excited: It's your birthday and you're having a party.
confundido/a: Acabas de comprar un ordenador nuevo y estás intentando leer las instrucciones.
confused: You've just bought a new computer and you are trying to read the instructions.
incómodo/a: Estás de pie en un tren abarrotado, cargando bolsas pesadas, y tienes demasiado calor.
uncomfortable: You are standing on a crowded train, carrying heavy bags, and you are too hot.
nervioso/a: Tienes que dar una charla ante 300 personas.
nervous: You have to give a talk to 300 people.
solitario/a (sentirse solo/a): Has decidido pasar un año en otro país, pero aún no has conocido a ningún amigo.
lonely: You have decided to spend a year in another country, but you haven't met any friends yet.
preocupado/a: Tienes una tos fuerte y la has tenido durante más de seis meses.
worried: You have got a bad cough and you have had it for more than six months.
asombrado/a: Estás esperando en un aeropuerto y ves a un amigo que no has visto en diez años.
amazed: You're waiting at an airport and you see a friend who you haven't seen for ten years.
aburrido/a: Estás esperando en una estación y tu tren se ha retrasado dos horas.
bored: You are waiting at a station and your train has been delayed for two hours.
Prefiero estar ocupado/a, así que siempre estoy haciendo cosas.
I prefer being busy, so I'm always doing things.
A algunas personas simplemente les gusta sentarse y no hacer nada.
Some people just like to sit down and do nothing.
Pero yo no puedo hacer eso.
A veces me siento solo/a si mi pareja se va por trabajo y estoy solo/a en casa.
I feel lonely sometimes if my partner goes away for work and I’m on my own at home.
Pero entonces llamo a un amigo/a o a mi hermana.
But then I call a friend or my sister.
O hablo con alguien con quien no he hablado en mucho tiempo.
Or I speak to someone who I haven't spoken to for a long time.
Entonces ya no me siento solo/a.
Then I don't feel lonely anymore.
Me confundo mucho cuando tengo que hacer algo con números,
I get really confused when I have to do anything with numbers,
como revisar facturas o tasas bancarias y cosas por el estilo.
like check bills or bank rates and things like that.
I hate that kind of thing.
I am always amazed by nature.
Puedes simplemente estar en un lugar hermoso y mirarlo, y es simplemente asombroso.
You can just stand in a beautiful place and look at it, and it's just amazing.
Me pongo nervioso/a cuando tengo que organizar un evento social,
I get nervous when I have to organise a social event,
como si voy a dar una fiesta o invitar a mucha gente a cenar a casa.
like if I'm having a party or lots of people round to dinner.
Me pongo nervioso/a sobre qué voy a cocinar y si tendré tiempo para hacerlo todo.
I get nervous about what I'm going to cook and if I'll have time to do everything.
Me preocupo por todo tipo de cosas.
I worry about all kinds of things.
A menudo me siento preocupado/a por el mundo cuando veo las noticias y todos los problemas.
Often I feel worried about the world when I see the news and all the problems.
Hay tantos problemas en el mundo
There are so many problems in the world
y la mayor parte del tiempo intento no pensar en ellos,
and a lot of the time I try not to think about them,
y entonces, de repente, empiezo a preocuparme.
and then suddenly, I'll start to worry.
